meanings.definition: Not able to be canceled or annulled.
meanings.sent1: The contract was noncancelable, so we had to fulfill our obligations.
meanings.sent2: The insurance policy was noncancelable once it was signed.
meanings.sent3: The noncancelable agreement made us stick to our plans, even when we wanted to change them.
meanings.sent4: Her determination to finish the project was as noncancelable as a stone wall.
meanings.sent5: The noncancelable nature of the promise made it impossible to go back on.

meanings.definition: Unable to be terminated or revoked.
meanings.sent1: The subscription was noncancelable, so we had to continue receiving the magazines.
meanings.sent2: The lease agreement became noncancelable after the first year.
meanings.sent3: His noncancelable decision to quit his job surprised everyone.
meanings.sent4: The bond between them was as noncancelable as a permanent marker.
meanings.sent5: The noncancelable rule was enforced without exceptions.
